result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan Michael Guibord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Case called. Defendant Alan Michael Guibord in court. Thomas Eisch from Probation in court. Court sets record. DE has paid $ 1,573.86 of restitution. Mr Eisch addresses court, gives argument for DE to be discharged from probation at end of term, with civil judgment for balance owed. Court addresses DE. Court addresses Probation Officer Eisch-no violations.
Court makes finding of good faith effort made by DE, DE may be discharged from probation at required time, with civil judgment taken.
Probation review hearing on October 25, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan Michael Guibord in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea to counts 3 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 3 and 4.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years report today- costs $443.00 in both counts - restitution to be determined jt/several with Matthew Guibord to be paid to Brian Bissonett - 
Eligible for expunction upon completion of probation automatically 
Counts 1 and 2 are dismissed and used as read-ins

Defendant Alan Michael Guibord in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  1:36 Pm  Court calls case and recites appearances.  
Defendant does wish to waive prelim.  Court advised him as to his right to a prelim - finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam.  Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Atty Marcoux requests plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Alan Michael Guibord in court with attorney Heidi J. Mangelsen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Counsel enters NG Plea on counts 3 and 4, court accepts.  Preliminary Hearing requested, time limites waived.  Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No Contact with Brian Bisonette or his residence
No Contact with Brian Bisonette or his residence.

Defendant Alan Michael Guibord in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF requested two week adjournment to have attorney present.   SIBS $2500 No Contact with Brian Bisonette or his residence.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
